samples.context: A restaurant critic reviewed two new restaurants in town - one serving Italian food and the other serving Indian food. Though he enjoyed aspects of both restaurants, it was not true that he gave excellent reviews to both the Italian and the Indian restaurant.
samples.question: Does it entail that either the Italian restaurant did not get an excellent review or the Indian restaurant did not get an excellent review or both?

samples.context: A band released two singles ahead of their new album. Despite high expectations from fans, it was not true that both songs went viral and got radio play.
samples.question: Does it entail that either the first single did not go viral or the second single did not go viral or both did not get radio play?

samples.context: A store manager inspected employees' customer service and product knowledge. Although the manager hoped all employees would excel, it was not true that they were proficient in both areas.
samples.question: Does it entail that either the employees lacked good customer service or lacked product knowledge or both?

samples.context: A student took two important exams this semester in math and science classes. Though he studied hard for both, it was not the case that he scored excellently on the math exam and the science exam.
samples.question: Does it entail that either he did not score excellently on the math exam or he did not score excellently on the science exam or both?

samples.context: At a dog show, a breeder entered two of her dogs in different categories. Despite preparing them both thoroughly, it was not the case that her dogs won Best in Show in their respective categories.
samples.question: Does it entail that either her first dog did not win Best in Show or her second dog did not win Best in Show or both?

samples.context: A company was bidding for two different contracts and had submitted separate proposals. However, despite being confident, it was not true that they won both contracts.
samples.question: Does it entail that either they did not win the first contract bid or they did not win the second contract bid or both?

samples.context: A store sold both laptops and tablets. Even though they advertised both products, it was not the case that they had strong sales for laptops and tablets.
samples.question: Does it entail that either laptop sales were weak or tablet sales were weak or both?

samples.context: A bakery sold two specialty cakes - red velvet and carrot cake. Despite marketing both cakes, it was not the case that they sold a lot of both cakes.
samples.question: Does it entail that either the red velvet cake didn't sell well or the carrot cake didn't sell well or both?

samples.context: In an art class, students were instructed to paint a still life scene with fruit. Despite the teacher's expectation, it was not true that both students used the appropriate brush techniques and mixed the correct paint colors.
samples.question: Does it entail that either the students did not use the right brush techniques or did not mix the correct paint colors or both?

samples.context: A store had two sales events on the same day. Though the store was busy, it was not the case that both sales attracted large crowds.
samples.question: Does it entail that either the first sale did not attract a crowd or the second sale did not attract a crowd or both?
